oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Flags; Tigers
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Confederate States of America - Army - Washington Artillery Battalion (New Orleans, La.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cover image of the "Washington Artillery Souvenir" booklet featuring a tiger surrounded by a laurel wreath with the words "Try Us" printed on a ribbon beneath the image. An American flag appears on the left and a blue flag featuring the slogan "Non Sibi Sed Suis" (not for oneself but for one's people) is on the left. A Confederate banner hangs above the image between the words "Washington Artillery."

The Washington Artillery was formed in 1838 as a militia battery. It received regimental status after serving in the Mexican-American War. During the Civil War it participated in the Battles of Antietam, Gettysburg, Shiloh, Fredericksburg, and Manassas. The regiment saw service in World War II and continues its service in the current U. S. military.
